title: Energy and pd - isoline map with points P Q R S T

content.question: A charge distribution (not shown) results in an electric field represented by the map of equipotential lines shown in the figure. For a system consisting of a positive test charge and the electric field, the system’s electric potential energy changes as the test charge is moved between the labeled locations <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, <math alttext="uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math>, <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math>, <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math>, and/or <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math>. For which of the following sequences of locations will the movement of the test charge result in the greatest net change in the system’s electric potential energy?

choices.label: <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> to <math alttext="uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math> to <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math>

<math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> to <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math> to <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>

<math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math> to <math alttext="uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math> to <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math>

<math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math> to <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></math> to <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> to <math alttext="uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math> to <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
